result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey N Broady was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Costs to be converted to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey N Broady

defendant.name: Broady, Corey N
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Angela Wang advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:27 AM Defendant Corey N Broady in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.   Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel has filed a plea questionnaire.  Parties are ready to proceed with plea and sentencing.   Court conducts colloquy with defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  State and Defense gave sentencing recommendations.  Defendant made statements to the Court. 

The Court Orders the Following:

**COUNT 1**

50 DAYS JAIL--STRAIGHT TIME.  (Credit - 34 days).  Sentence commences immediately.

FINE or COSTS: $ 243.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
Fine and costs to be immediately converted to civil judgment. 

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

02:27 PM Defendant Corey N Broady in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant is currently on a probation and parole hold.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
